us.ihmc.euclid.geometry

Class Sphere3D

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.ihmc.euclid.geometry.Shape3D<Sphere3D>
      • us.ihmc.euclid.geometry.Sphere3D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Clearable, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.EpsilonComparable<Sphere3D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometricallyComparable<Sphere3D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometryObject<Sphere3D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Settable<Sphere3D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Transformable

    public class Sphere3D
extends Shape3D<Sphere3D>
    Sphere3D represents a 3D sphere defined by its radius and with its origin at its center.

      • intersectionWith

        public int intersectionWith(Line3DReadOnly line,
                            us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DBasics firstIntersectionToPack,
                            us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DBasics secondIntersectionToPack)
        Computes the coordinates of the possible intersections between a line and this sphere.

        In the case the line and this sphere do not intersect, this method returns 0 and firstIntersectionToPack and secondIntersectionToPack remain unmodified.

        Parameters:
        line - the line expressed in world coordinates that may intersect this sphere. Not modified.
        firstIntersectionToPack - the coordinate in world of the first intersection. Can be null. Modified.
        secondIntersectionToPack - the coordinate in world of the second intersection. Can be null. Modified.
        Returns:
        the number of intersections between the line and this sphere. It is either equal to 0, 1, or 2.

      • intersectionWith

        public int intersectionWith(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DReadOnly pointOnLine,
                            us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Vector3DReadOnly lineDirection,
                            us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DBasics firstIntersectionToPack,
                            us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DBasics secondIntersectionToPack)
        Computes the coordinates of the possible intersections between a line and this sphere.

        In the case the line and this sphere do not intersect, this method returns 0 and firstIntersectionToPack and secondIntersectionToPack are set to Double.NaN.

        Parameters:
        pointOnLine - a point expressed in world located on the infinitely long line. Not modified.
        lineDirection - the direction expressed in world of the line. Not modified.s
        firstIntersectionToPack - the coordinate in world of the first intersection. Can be null. Modified.
        secondIntersectionToPack - the coordinate in world of the second intersection. Can be null. Modified.
        Returns:
        the number of intersections between the line and this sphere. It is either equal to 0, 1, or 2.

      • isInsideEpsilonShapeFrame

        protected boolean isInsideEpsilonShapeFrame(double x,
                                            double y,
                                            double z,
                                            double epsilon)
        Tests if the query is located inside this shape given the tolerance epsilon.

        • if epsilon > 0, the size of this shape is increased by shifting its surface/faces by a distance of epsilon toward the outside.
        • if epsilon > 0, the size of this shape is reduced by shifting its surface/faces by a distance of epsilon toward the inside.

        Specified by:
        isInsideEpsilonShapeFrame in class Shape3D<Sphere3D>
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the query expressed in the local coordinates of this shape.
        y - the y-coordinate of the query expressed in the local coordinates of this shape.
        z - the z-coordinate of the query expressed in the local coordinates of this shape.
        epsilon - the tolerance to use for this test.
        Returns:
        true if the query is considered to be inside this shape, false otherwise.

      • evaluateQuery

        protected double evaluateQuery(double x,
                               double y,
                               double z,
                               us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DBasics closestPointToPack,
                               us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Vector3DBasics normalToPack)
        Internal generic method used for the public API of any Shape3d.
        Specified by:
        evaluateQuery in class Shape3D<Sphere3D>
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the query expressed in the local coordinates of this shape.
        y - the y-coordinate of the query expressed in the local coordinates of this shape.
        z - the z-coordinate of the query expressed in the local coordinates of this shape.
        closestPointToPack - closest point to the query expressed in the local coordinates of this shape. Modified. Can be null.
        normalToPack - normal of the shape surface at the closest point. Modified. Can be null.
        Returns:
        the distance from the query to the closest point on the shape surface. The returned value is expected to be negative when the query is inside the shape.

      • epsilonEquals

        public boolean epsilonEquals(Sphere3D other,
                             double epsilon)
        Tests separately and on a per component basis if the pose and the radius of this sphere and other's pose and radius are equal to an epsilon.
        Parameters:
        other - the other sphere which pose and radius is to be compared against this radius pose and radius. Not modified.
        epsilon - tolerance to use when comparing each component.
        Returns:
        true if the two spheres are equal component-wise, false otherwise.

      • geometricallyEquals

        public boolean geometricallyEquals(Sphere3D other,
                                   double epsilon)
        Compares this to other to determine if the two spheres are geometrically similar, i.e. the position of each sphere is geometrically similar given epsilon and the difference between the radius of each sphere is less than or equal to epsilon.
        Parameters:
        other - the sphere to compare to. Not modified.
        epsilon - the tolerance of the comparison.
        Returns:
        true if the two boxes represent the same geometry, false otherwise.
